ygData.subject: Re: Pulling Out Slowly
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Allright, Kluster replies. Good work. Try to get as much power there as possible. He frowns, looking over at Proto, who was stumbling along behind

::Kluster/Proto/Firearm::

"Allright," Kluster replies. "Good work. Try to get as much power 
there as possible."

He frowns, looking over at Proto, who was stumbling along behind 
Firearm.

"Are you allright, Proto?" He asks, approaching the bot.

"Yes sir," Proto replies between breaths, "I'm fine."

Proto stumbles again, this time pitching forward and hitting the 
ground. His body relaxes, laying still.

Kluster instantly kneels next to him, rolling him over on his back. 
He sighs, seeing the damage to the bot's chest.

"Why didn't you get some help, Proto?" He mutters to the dead bot, 
lifting him on his shoulder. He looks at Firearm, who had turned to 
look at Proto.

"He's gone," Kluster says, Firearm nodding sadly and both of them 
walking off toward the CF again, obvioustly saddened by the loss of 
their teammate.




--- In nbwrpg@y..., "FIRE FOX" <firefox_y2k@h...> wrote:
> Hysteria:
> 
> Hysteria clambered through the long vent. Her face was covered with 
soot and 
> grease. She had slowly been making her way through the CF for the 
past ten 
> minutes, doing her best to reconnect what was left of certain 
wires. She 
> stopped crawling for a few moments while she answered IR's comm. 
Her 
> breathing was slightly labored:
> 
> "I've been trying for the past ten minutes commander. Give me a few 
more 
> minutes, and I should have the problem fixed."
> 
> Hysteria then opened a comm to Kluster:
> 
> "First I have to disengage the lockdown, then I'll do my best to 
reroute 
> power, but no promises. Hysteria out."
> 
> She clambered through the remaining stretch of vent and dropped 
into the 
> damaged bridge:
> 
> "Just one more..."
> 
> Hysteria slid under the smaller, still active console and 
reconnected two 
> frayed wire ends:
> 
> "OUCH!" Hysteria pulled back and smacked her head against the 
underside of 
> the console. The wires had sparked her, and it hurt. She opened a 
comm to IR 
> and Kluster:
> 
> "I'm going to attempt to disengage the lockdown, wish me luck."
> 
> Hysteria tapped out a few codes and passwords on the small console. 
Outside 
> the extra layers of steel slide back, exposing the regular doors. 
The 
> lockdown had been disengaged. A few seconds later Hysteria tapped 
out 
> several more commands, and succesfully rerouted some power to the 
CRs. She 
> opened a comm to Kluster:
> 
> "Reroute complete. There's some power, not much, but it should be 
enough."
> 
> Hysteria closed the comm and watched as the lights in the CF's 
bridge 
> blinked on and off several times:
> 
> "I hope."
